chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kamari J Roy

records.addlTxt: Substitution of Judge request by Defendant, filed.

Defendant Kamari J Roy appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas appeared by video for Kamari J Roy.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer D. Sutyak. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Arraignment scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of Adjournment of Preliminary Hearing ( 9 pages) commencing 09-02-2022 by Debra A. Wisniewski.
Filed: Original Transcript of Adjournment of Preliminary Hearing (9 pages) commencing 09-02-2022 by Debra Wisniewski.

Defendant Kamari J Roy not in court, in custody in MSDF.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas appeared by video for Kamari J Roy.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant unable to appear by video from MSDF. Case is adjourned. Defense Counsel motions to dismiss. denies the motion. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kamari J Roy not in court, in custody in MSDF.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas in court in person for Kamari J Roy.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defendant unable to appear by video from MSDF. Defense moves to dismiss. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Kamari J Roy not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.

Defendant Kamari J Roy in court with attorney Jane Jerman.  Defendant Kamari J Roy in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
